Abeyance.definition: a lapse in the succession of property during which there is no person in whom title to the property is vested usually used with in [the estate was in ] 2
Abeyance.origin: [Middle French abeance expectation (of a title or claimant), from abaer to expect, from a -, prefix stressing result + baer to gape, aim at]

1.definition: a lapse in the succession of property during which there is no person in whom title to the property is vested usually used with[the estate was in ]

2.definition: temporary inactivity or suppressioncessation or suspension for a period of time usually used withor[to hold the entry of summary judgment in "J. H. Friedenthal"]
2.into: [to hold the entry of summary judgment in "J. H. Friedenthal
